verses.roman:
evaṁ vikatthamānasya
kupito devakī-sutaḥ
rajakasya karāgreṇa
śiraḥ kāyād apātayat

synonyms: evam—thus; vikatthamānasya—who was brazenly speaking; kupitaḥ—angered; devakī-sutaḥ—Kṛṣṇa, the son of Devakī; rajakasya—of the washerman; kara—of one hand; agreṇa—with the front; śiraḥ—the head; kāyāt—from his body; apātayat—made fall.
translation: As the washerman thus spoke brazenly, the son of Devakī became angry, and then merely with His fingertips He separated the man's head from his body.
